1.name: Act of Violence
1.description: An embittered, vengeful POW stalks his former commanding officer who betrayed his men's planned escape attempt from a Nazi prison camp.

2.name: White Heat
2.description: A psychopathic criminal with a mother complex makes a daring break from prison and leads his old gang in a chemical plant payroll heist. Shortly after the plan takes place, events take a crazy turn.

3.name: The Third Man
3.description: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

4.name: Little Women
4.description: A group of sisters experience life's difficulties and its pleasures while growing up in nineteenth-century America.

5.name: The Fountainhead
5.description: An uncompromising, visionary architect struggles to maintain his integrity and individualism despite personal, professional and economic pressures to conform to popular standards.

6.name: Samson and Delilah
6.description: When strongman Samson rejects the love of the beautiful Philistine woman Delilah, she seeks vengeance that brings horrible consequences they both regret.

7.name: Kind Hearts and Coronets
7.description: A distant poor relative of the Duke of D'Ascoyne plots to inherit the title by murdering the eight other heirs who stand ahead of him in the line of succession.

8.name: A Woman's Secret
8.description: Failed singer Marian Washburn confesses she shot her friend, successful singer Susan Caldwell, but her manager Luke Jordan and Detective Fowler doubt her story and cannot establish a reasonable motive.

9.name: The Fighting Kentuckian
9.description: In 1818 Alabama, French settlers are pitted against greedy land-grabber Blake Randolph but Kentucky militiaman John Breen, who's smitten with French gal Fleurette De Marchand, comes to the settlers' aid.

10.name: Red Canyon
10.description: A young girl set out to tame a wild horse so she can enter him in a race.

11.name: All the King's Men
11.description: The rise and fall of a corrupt politician, who makes his friends richer and retains power by dint of a populist appeal.

12.name: Gun Law Justice
12.description: Jimmy Wakely befriends Hank Cardigan, a former outlaw who has served his sentence and wants to go straight. Jimmy, after clearing Hank of a wrongful shooting charge, helps him get a job as ...                See full summary »

13.name: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
13.description: Captain Nathan Brittles, on the eve of retirement, takes out a last patrol to stop an impending massive Indian attack. Encumbered by women who must be evacuated, Brittles finds his mission imperiled.

14.name: Sands of Iwo Jima
14.description: A dramatization of the World War II Battle of Iwo Jima.

15.name: On the Town
15.description: Three sailors on a day of shore leave in New York City look for fun and romance before their twenty-four hours are up.

16.name: House of Strangers
16.description: After years in prison, Max promises revenge on his brothers for their betrayal. His lover Irene and memories of his past yield him a broader perspective.

17.name: A Letter to Three Wives
17.description: A letter is addressed to three wives from their "best friend" Addie Ross, announcing that she is running away with one of their husbands...but she does not say which one.

18.name: Twelve O'Clock High
18.description: A hard-as-nails general takes over a bomber unit suffering from low morale and whips them into fighting shape.

19.name: Adam's Rib
19.description: Domestic and professional tensions mount when a husband and wife work as opposing lawyers in a case involving a woman who shot her husband.

20.name: The Heiress
20.description: A young naive woman falls for a handsome young man who her emotionally abusive father suspects is a fortune hunter.

21.name: Battleground
21.description: True tale about a squad of the 101st Airborne Division coping with being trapped by the Nazis in the besieged city of Bastogne, Belgium during the Battle of the Bulge in December of 1944.

22.name: The Big Steal
22.description: An army lieutenant accused of robbery pursues the real thief on a frantic chase through Mexico aided by the thief's fiancee.

23.name: The Hasty Heart
23.description: In the final days of WW2, in a M.A.S.H. unit in Burma, a severely wounded corporal watches in dismay as fellow soldiers pack-up to return home but a caring nurse and five remaining soldiers bring him solace.

24.name: The Blue Lagoon
24.description: In the Victorian period, two children are shipwrecked on a tropical island in the South Pacific and fall in love while growing up together.

25.name: The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad
25.description: An animated adaptation of "The Wind in the Willows" followed by an adaptation of "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow".

26.name: The Secret Garden
26.description: A girl is sent to live with her uncle on his estate when her parents die. There she discovers much intrigue, family history and secrets and personal baggage. In particular, a screaming child and...a secret garden.

27.name: D.O.A.
27.description: Frank Bigelow, told he's been poisoned and has only a few days to live, tries to find out who killed him and why.

28.name: Criss Cross
28.description: An armored truck driver and his lovely ex-wife conspire with a gang to have his own truck robbed on the route.

29.name: Too Late for Tears
29.description: Through a fluke circumstance a ruthless woman stumbles across a suitcase filled with $60,000, and she is determined to hold onto it even if it means murder.

30.name: John Loves Mary
30.description: A GI marries the English girlfriend of his best friend to get her into the U.S. for his friend who lost track of her in the war only to find on returning home that he is stuck with the girl because the friend has married someone else.

31.name: Eureka Stockade
31.description: In 1854, Australian gold rush miners struggle for their rights against an oppressive government.

32.name: Under Capricorn
32.description: A young gentleman goes to Australia where he reunites with his now married childhood sweetheart, only to find out she has become an alcoholic and harbors dark secrets.

33.name: Nora inu
33.description: During a sweltering summer, a rookie homicide detective tries to track down his stolen Colt pistol.

34.name: Whisky Galore!
34.description: Scottish islanders try to plunder 50,000 cases of whisky from a stranded ship.

35.name: Banshun
35.description: Noriko is twenty-seven years old and still living with her widowed father. Everybody tries to talk her into marrying, but Noriko wants to stay at home caring for her father.

36.name: Batman and Robin
36.description: The caped crusaders versus The Wizard, black-hooded mastermind.

37.name: Mighty Joe Young
37.description: A young woman who has raised a giant gorilla from an infant brings him to Hollywood years later seeking her fortune in order to save her family's ranch.

38.name: The Great Gatsby
38.description: A Jazz Age bootlegger learns the hard way about the wages of sin.

39.name: Champion
39.description: Boxer Midge Kelly rises to fame...mainly by stepping on other people.

40.name: Pinky
40.description: A light-skinned black woman falls in love with a white doctor, though he is unaware of her true race.

41.name: In the Good Old Summertime
41.description: In turn-of-the century America, Andrew and Veronica are co-workers in a music shop who dislike one another during working hours but unwillingly carry on an anonymous romance through the mail.

42.name: Ma and Pa Kettle
42.description: On the verge of being evicted from their run-down farmhouse, the large Kettle family is given a new, modern home after Pa wins a contest, but he is accused of plagiarizing his winning slogan by a jealous local woman.

43.name: The Window
43.description: To avoid the heat of a sweltering summer night a 9-year-old Manhattan boy decides to sleep on the fire escape and witnesses a murder, but no one will believe him.

44.name: Riso amaro
44.description: Two criminals on the run end up working in a rice field and decide to recruit other workers for their next robbery.

45.name: The Set-Up
45.description: Because aging boxer Bill Thompson always lost his past fights, his corrupt manager, without telling Thompson, takes bribes from a betting gangster, to ensure Thompson's pre-arranged dive-loss in the next match.

46.name: That Midnight Kiss
46.description: In Philadelphia, the soprano Prudence Budell returns from Europe after a period of five years training in the best Europeans music schools. Her millionaire grandmother Abigail Trent Budell ...                See full summary »

47.name: Jour de fête
47.description: Once a year the fair comes for one day to the little town 'Sainte-Severe-sur-Indre'. All inhabitants are scoffing at Francois, the postman, what he seems not to recognize. The rising of the...                See full summary »

48.name: Impact
48.description: A unfaithful wife plots with her lover to kill her husband, but the lover is accidentally killed instead. The husband stays in hiding, and lets his wife be charged with conspiracy.

49.name: Reign of Terror
49.description: Robespierrre, a powerful figure in the French revolution, is desperately looking for his black book, a death list of those marked for the guillotine.

50.name: I Was a Male War Bride
50.description: After marrying an American lieutenant with whom he was assigned to work in post-war Germany, a French captain attempts to find a way to accompany her back to the States under the terms of the War Bride Act.
